Pre-Game Insights: The Indonesian national team carried a mission of revenge against Bahrain.
The Indonesian national team looked at the duel with various missions, with the first target being to get three points.
Ranked, Bahrain is far above Indonesia, with Bahrain in 76th position and Indonesia in 129th.
Meeting records show that Bahrain won three times, Indonesia won twice, and two matches ended in a draw out of a total of seven meetings since 1980.
Since being handled by Shin Tae-yong, the Indonesian national team has been taken into account at the Asian level, reaching the first knockout phase in history in the 2023 Asian Cup.
In the first two matches of the 2026 World Cup Qualification, Indonesia drew with Saudi Arabia (1-1) and Australia (0-0).
The Indonesian national team aims to improve their meeting record against Bahrain.
The last meeting in the 2014 World Cup Qualification saw Indonesia lose 0-10 to Bahrain.
The Indonesian national team is now much different, with naturalized players in almost all lines and a deeper squad.
PSSI, which is no longer in conflict, has allowed the team to focus on preparations.
Shin Tae-yong's big mission is to make history by qualifying for the World Cup for the first time.
The top two teams in Group C of the Third Round of 2026 World Cup Qualifiers will qualify automatically for the 2026 World Cup.
The Indonesian national team is currently in fourth place with two points from two matches.
The match against Bahrain will be held at the Bahrain National Stadium, Riffa, on Thursday, October 10, 2024, at 23.00 WIB.
Others: Formation Forecast: Bahrain (4-2-3-1): Ebrahim Lutfala; Amine Benadi, Sayed Mahdi, Vincente Emmanuel, Abdulla Alkhulasi; Abbas Alasfoor, Ali Haram; Ali Madan, Mohamed Marhoon, Mahdi Abdouljabbar; Komail Alaswad

Formation Forecast: Indonesia (3-4-2-1): Ernando Ari; Rizky Ridho, Jay Idzes, Mees Hilgers; Sandy Walsh, Ivar Janner, Nathan Tjoe-A-On, Calvin Verdok; Eliano Reijnders, Ragnar Oratmangoen; Rafael Struick
